SENT.plain: Coronary anomalies are rare, with a reported prevalence of 1.3% among patients who undergo coronary angiography
The great majority of coronary artery anomalies are incidental findings and are not clinically significant, but in some cases, may be responsible for angina, syncope, arrhythmias or even sudden death
In the following case, we describe coronary CT angiography findings of one of the rarest coronary anomalies
Lipton R-I type single right coronary artery has only been previously reported in very few occasions and has been seen in only 0.0007% of the population
